title: PIER ORB / communistquest
description: Rhetoric smells a communist around here. Part of the Communist Dream Quest

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "There it is again! There's a spectr..."
dialogueTree.text: There it is again! There's a spectral scent haunting this pier, no doubt. And it smells like...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Sea brine, mostly. Because it's a p..."
links.text: Sea brine, mostly. Because it's a pier.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Years of turmoil, of hopes and drea..."
links.text: Years of turmoil, of hopes and dreams ground beneath the inexorable tides of capital.

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.text: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)

links.title: You: "I *still* don't smell anything."
links.text: I *still* don't smell anything.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Absolute rubbish. Your politico-olf..."
links.text: Absolute rubbish. Your politico-olfactory cortex doesn't deceive you. The smell is coming... from that balcony over there!

links.title: You: "I can *kind of* smell dreams being..."
links.text: I can *kind of* smell dreams being ground down by capital.

links.title: You: "Smell what?"
links.text: Smell what?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Can you not detect that inimitable..."
links.text: Can you not detect that inimitable whiff of dissatisfaction and restlessness, that sense that the world is in need of dramatic, even violent re-ordering?

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.text: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)

links.title: Rhetoric: "What do you smell?"
links.text: What do you smell?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The first thing that strikes you is..."
links.text: The first thing that strikes you is the overwhelming brine. You imagine yourself underwater, a hundred-legged arthropod scuttling along the murky silt at the bottom of the sea...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "But then the unmistakable reek of *..."
links.text: But then the unmistakable reek of *seagull shit* hits you, buoyed along on the air currents, an acrid melody atop mouldering chords of wood rot and heavy fuel oil.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Still smelling for communists, det..."
links.text: "Still smelling for communists, detective?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I'll be over here when you'v..."
links.text: "Well, I'll be over here when you've finished." The lieutenant nudges a piece of trash with his foot.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "His impatience is feigned. He's act..."
links.text: His impatience is feigned. He's actually curious to see how this *personal errand* shakes out.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He'll tolerate this *personal erran..."
links.text: He'll tolerate this *personal errand*, but his patience is wearing thin.

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Uh huh.""
links.text: "Uh huh."

links.title: Drama: "The lieutenant issss *not* persuade..."
links.text: The lieutenant issss *not* persuaded, sssssire.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What the lieutenant thinks is irrel..."
links.text: What the lieutenant thinks is irrelevant. Your politico-olfactory cortex is lighting up like a holiday display. The scent of communism is overwhelming, and it's coming right... from that balcony over there!

links.title: You: ""What makes you say that?""
links.text: "What makes you say that?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No offence, detective, but you're..."
links.text: "No offence, detective, but you're not particularly *subtle*."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The lieutenant's right. It's sort o..."
links.text: The lieutenant's right. It's sort of amazing how *un-subtly* you're sniffing the air around you, almost like you're *trying* to call attention to yourself.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective?" T..."
links.text: "Everything in order, detective?" The lieutenant gives you a quizzical look.

links.title: You: ""It's kind of a personal errand.""
links.text: "It's kind of a personal errand."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A personal errand.""
links.text: "A personal errand."

links.title: You: ""I'm smelling for communists, Kim.""
links.text: "I'm smelling for communists, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're smelling for...""
links.text: "You're smelling for..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know what? I'll just leave you..."
links.text: "You know what? I'll just leave you to it. Carry on, detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm struggling to see the connecti..."
links.text: "I'm struggling to see the connection with our investigation, but I'm sure *all will be revealed* in time."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do remember that we're investi..."
links.text: "You do remember that we're investigating a *murder*, yes? I would appreciate it if you reserved your political projects for after-hours."

links.title: Rhetoric: "The lieutenant lacks your highly de..."
links.text: The lieutenant lacks your highly developed politico-olfactory cortex. The smell is undeniable. And it's coming... from that balcony up there!

links.title: You: ""I'm working on developing my polit..."
links.text: "I'm working on developing my political consciousness."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're developing your...""
links.text: "You're developing your..."

links.title: You: ""Just taking in the fresh air, like..."
links.text: "Just taking in the fresh air, like a normal detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a lot to take in, isn't th..."
links.text: "There's a lot to take in, isn't there?" The lieutenant wrinkles his nose.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "It smells like a pier, in other wor..."
links.text: It smells like a pier, in other words. A completely ordinary pier, that provokes no ideological associations whatsoever.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Nothing. Or at least, nothing in pa..."
links.text: Nothing. Or at least, nothing in particular. As far as you're concerned, your nose seems to be purely decorative.

links.title: You: "Are you saying there's a communist..."
links.text: Are you saying there's a communist nearby?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Without a doubt. Your politico-olfa..."
links.text: Without a doubt. Your politico-olfactory cortex doesn't deceive you. The smell is coming... from that balcony over there!

links.title: You: "You mean from Cindy?"
links.text: You mean from Cindy?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Certainement! A precocious communis..."
links.text: Certainement! A precocious communist youth, a symbol of a kinder, more hopeful future. Now's your chance to *establish contact* with your revolutionary brothers and sisters.

links.title: Inland Empire: "A chance to establish contact with..."
links.text: A chance to establish contact with the future! What a beautiful, *terrible* thought...

links.title: You: "You mean from that scary-looking gi..."
links.text: You mean from that scary-looking girl in the old lady coat?

links.title: You: "I don't smell anything."
links.text: I don't smell anything.
